H0.text: Which prominent Irish Nationalist was hung for treason in 1916 due to his involvement in the Easter Uprising. Patrick Pearse

H1.text: Which prominent Irish Nationalist was hung for treason in 1916 due to his involvement in the Easter Uprising. James Connolly

H2.text: Which prominent Irish Nationalist was hung for treason in 1916 due to his involvement in the Easter Uprising. Éamon de Valera

H3.text: Which prominent Irish Nationalist was hung for treason in 1916 due to his involvement in the Easter Uprising. Easmainn

A4.text: He was wounded in the fighting and, following the rebel surrender at the end of Easter week, was executed along with the six other signatories to the Proclamation of the Irish Republic.

A5.text: Executions in Kilmainham Gaol began on 3 May 1916 with Connolly's co-signatories to the Proclamation, Patrick Pearse, Tom Clarke and Thomas McDonagh.

A6.text: Pearse was executed on the morning of 3 May 1916.

A7.text: Pearse and fourteen other leaders, including his brother Willie, were court-martialled and executed by firing squad.

A8.text: 3 May: Patrick Pearse, Thomas MacDonagh and Thomas Clarke

A9.text: 12 May: James Connolly and Seán Mac Diarmada
